text: I know the power teachers have to change lives. While teaching may look a little different these days, thank you to those going above and beyond for your students. Your work matters and I won't stop fighting until you get a much-needed raise. #TeacherAppreciationWeek

Leilani Jordan was an essential worker who went out of her way to help elderly shoppers with their grocery needs. She risked her life to help others—we must do our part to honor her.

It’s long past time for Congress to pass an Essential Workers Bill of Rights. https://twitter.com/TIME/status/1257279208453279746 QT @TIME Leilani Jordan, 27, worked part-time as a greeter at a grocery store. When her mother tried to tell Jordan, who suffered from cerebral palsy, about the risks associated with her work, she remained undeterred.
